column4: Looking at a step by step guide.... this has to be (it seems) the most straight forward program installation ever
what are you instaling?
oh, excellent :)
may I send you a /msg?
yes
you need to be registered though (which you are not)
It go through that time?
nope, just mount them
not sure how to mount them.
sudo fdisk -l to find which is the fat32
then "sudo mkdir /mnt/fat32 && mount /dev/hd? /mnt/fat32"
but change the hd? to what it actually is
and in the future, drop the mkdir /mnt/fat32 part
and.. you need a sudo infront of mount /dev/hd?
oh :)

when I double click Install I get the whole "Where are you" and etc and get to "Prepare disk space".  I choose the drive and "Resize blah blah and use freed space" then "next"  It flashes a few things up REALLY quick then says "Failed to create enough space for installation"
how much space are you giving it?
should be more than enough
heh, unless you are installing the internet
ok um, hmm.. have you tried partioning with another live cd?
there is a live cd called "gparted"
